meanings.definition: A person or tool that cuts notches.
meanings.sent1: The skilled notcher carefully carved out the notches in the wood.
meanings.sent2: I need a notcher to help me make precise cuts in this project.
meanings.sent3: The notcher and his trusty saw were always ready for a new woodworking challenge.
meanings.sent4: She was a notcher in the art of creating intricate designs with her woodworking tools.
meanings.sent5: The notcher's job was to ensure each piece of wood had perfectly aligned notches.

meanings.sent1: He used a sharp knife to notcher the edges of the paper.
meanings.sent2: Please notcher the corners of the fabric before sewing them together.
meanings.sent3: She decided to notcher a heart shape into the tree trunk as a symbol of love.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor carefully notchered away at the marble block to reveal the hidden figure within.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter notchered the wooden beam to fit perfectly into place.

meanings.definition: A device used for creating notches in material.
meanings.sent1: The metal notcher was essential for making precise cuts in the sheet metal.
meanings.sent2: I need to purchase a new notcher for my workshop to improve my efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The automatic notcher made the task of cutting notches much quicker and easier.
meanings.sent4: The notcher hummed softly as it smoothly cut through the thick leather material.
meanings.sent5: The old notcher had been passed down through generations of craftsmen.
